data.enText: held
held
in hand/arms
to carry sth; to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.
She was holding a large box.

data.chText: 我抓着耗子的尾巴倒提起来。
data.enText: I held the mouse by its tail.

data.chText: 女孩紧紧地拉着她父亲的手。
data.enText: The girl held her father's hand tightly.
He was holding the baby in his arms.

data.chText: 获胜队的队长把奖杯高举到空中。
data.enText: The winning captain held the trophy in the air.
We were holding hands (= holding each other's hands) .
The lovers held each other close.

data.chText: 抱住，捂住，按住（受伤的身体部位等）
data.enText: to put your hand on part of your body, usually because it hurts
She groaned and held her head.
in position
to keep sb/sth in a particular position
Hold your head up.

data.chText: 保持这个姿势别动，数到10。
data.enText: Hold this position for a count of 10.

data.chText: 这木头用夹钳固定住了。
data.enText: The wood is held in position by a clamp.

data.chText: 我得把肚皮收紧才能拉上牛仔裤的拉链。
data.enText: I had to hold my stomach in (= pull the muscles flat) to zip up my jeans.
I'll hold the door open for you.
support
to support the weight of sb/sth

data.chText: 我觉得那根树枝撑不住你的重量。
data.enText: I don't think that branch will hold your weight.
contain
to have enough space for sth/sb; to contain sth/sb
This barrel holds 25 litres.

data.chText: 这架飞机可容纳大约300名乘客。
data.enText: The plane holds about 300 passengers.
sb prisoner
to keep sb and not allow them to leave

data.chText: 警方拘留了两名与上星期四的银行抢劫案有关的男子。
data.enText: Police are holding two men in connection with last Thursday's bank raid.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: He was held prisoner for two years.
control
to defend sth against attack; to have control of sth
The rebels held the radio station.
remain
to remain strong and safe or in position
They were afraid the dam wouldn't hold.
to remain the same
How long will the fine weather hold?

data.chText: 如果他们的好运持续下去，他们仍能赢得冠军。
data.enText: If their luck holds, they could still win the championship.
keep

data.chText: 使（注意力或兴趣）持续不减；吸引住
data.enText: to keep sb's attention or interest

data.chText: 博物馆中没有很多让我感兴趣的东西。
data.enText: There wasn't much in the museum to hold my attention.

data.chText: 使保持同样程度（或比率、速度等）
data.enText: to keep sth at the same level, rate, speed, etc.
Hold your speed at 70.
to keep sth so that it can be used later
records held on computer

data.chText: 律师保存着我们的遗嘱。
data.enText: Our solicitor holds our wills.

data.chText: 您的预订我们可以保留三天。
data.enText: We can hold your reservation for three days.
own
to own or have sth
Employees hold 30% of the shares.
job
to have a particular job or position
How long has he held office?
record/title
to have sth you have gained or achieved

data.chText: 跳远世界纪录的保持者是谁？
data.enText: Who holds the world record for the long jump?

data.chText: 她保持了三年的世界冠军头衔。
data.enText: She held the title of world champion for three years.
opinion
to have a belief or an opinion about sb/sth

data.chText: 他对教育的看法不同寻常。
data.enText: He holds strange views on education.
She is held in high regard by her students (= they have a high opinion of her) .
firmly-held beliefs
to consider that sth is true

data.chText: 我仍然认为政府的经济政策是错误的。
data.enText: I still hold that the government's economic policies are mistaken.

data.chText: 父母将要对孩子的行为负责。
data.enText: Parents will be held responsible for their children's behaviour.

data.chText: 这些花瓶被视为希腊艺术的最佳典范。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: These vases are held to be the finest examples of Greek art.

data.text: This pattern is usually used in the passive.
此句型通常用于被动语态。

data.enText: meeting
to have a meeting, competition, conversation, etc.

data.chText: 会议将在社区活动中心举行。
data.enText: The meeting will be held in the community centre.

data.chText: 噪音这么大，根本没法进行交谈。
data.enText: It's impossible to hold a conversation with all this noise.
road/course

data.chText: （尤指机动车高速时）平稳行驶
data.enText: if a vehicle holds the road , it is in close contact with the road and easy to control, especially when driven fast
if a ship or an aircraft holds a course , it continues to move in a particular direction
in music
to make a note continue for a particular time
on telephone
to wait until you can speak to the person you have telephoned

data.chText: 分机现在占线。您能等一会吗？
data.enText: That extension is busy right now. Can you hold?
She asked me to hold the line .
stop
used to tell sb to stop doing sth or not to do sth
Hold your fire! (= don't shoot)
Hold the front page! (= don't print it until a particular piece of news is available)

data.chText: 给我来份热狗，但别加芥末。
data.enText: Give me a hot dog, but hold the (= don't give me any) mustard.

data.chText: 大多数含hold的习语，都可在该等习语中的名词及形容词相关词条找到，如hold the fort在词条fort下。
data.enText: Most idioms containing hold are at the entries for the nouns and adjectives in the idioms, for example hold the fort is at fort .
hold good
to be true

data.chText: 同样的论点并非在所有的情况下都正确。
data.enText: The same argument does not hold good in every case.
hold it
used to ask sb to wait, or not to move

data.chText: 请稍候——我想人还没有到齐。
data.enText: Hold it a second─I don't think everyone's arrived yet.
there is no holding sb
a person cannot be prevented from doing sth

data.chText: 她一谈起政治就滔滔不绝。
data.enText: Once she gets onto the subject of politics there's no holding her.
hold sth against sb

data.chText: 因某人的所为而对其评价低
data.enText: to allow sth that sb has done to make you have a lower opinion of them

data.chText: 我承认我做错了——但别因此而看不起我。
data.enText: I admit I made a mistake─but don't hold it against me.
hold sb/sth↔back
to prevent sb/sth from moving forward or crossing sth
The police were unable to hold back the crowd.
to prevent the progress or development of sb/sth

data.chText: 你认为把不同能力的学生混合在一起的班级会妨碍较高水平学生的进步吗？
data.enText: Do you think that mixed-ability classes hold back the better students?
hold sth↔back

data.chText: 不向（某人）透露情况；隐瞒
data.enText: to not tell sb sth they want or need to know
to hold back information

data.chText: 抑制，控制（感情等）；不露声色
data.enText: to stop yourself from expressing how you really feel

data.chText: 她勉强压住了自己的怒火。
data.enText: She just managed to hold back her anger.

data.chText: 他勇敢地没让眼泪流出来。
data.enText: He bravely held back his tears.
hold back (from doing sth)
hold sb back (from doing sth)
to hesitate or to make sb hesitate to act or speak

data.chText: 她踌躇着，不知如何说出这一可怕的消息。
data.enText: She held back, not knowing how to break the terrible news.

data.chText: 我本想告诉他真实情况，但又开不了口。
data.enText: I wanted to tell him the truth, but something held me back.
hold sb↔down
to prevent sb from moving, using force
It took three men to hold him down.

data.chText: 剥夺某人的自由（或权利）
data.enText: to prevent sb from having their freedom or rights

data.chText: 人民受到了专制政权的压迫。
data.enText: The people are held down by a repressive regime.
hold sth↔down
to keep sth at a low level

data.chText: 通货膨胀率必须控制在低水平上。
data.enText: The rate of inflation must be held down.
to keep a job for some time

data.chText: 他精神崩溃以后就没能保住工作。
data.enText: He was unable to hold down a job after his breakdown.
to limit sth, especially a noise
Hold it down, will you? I'm trying to sleep!
hold forth
to speak for a long time about sth in a way that other people might find boring
hold sth↔in
to not express how you really feel
to hold in your feelings/anger
hold off
to not start

data.chText: 雨还好，等到我们用完野餐才下起来。
data.enText: The rain held off just long enough for us to have our picnic.
to not do sth immediately

data.chText: 我们现在就可以买新计算机，不然就等到降价再说。
data.enText: We could get a new computer now or hold off until prices are lower.

data.chText: 你能推迟几天再作决定吗？
data.enText: Could you hold off making your decision for a few days?
hold sb/sth↔off
to stop sb/sth defeating you

data.chText: 她最后一刻甩掉了所有对手，以新的纪录赢得了赛跑冠军。
data.enText: She held off all the last-minute challengers and won the race in a new record time.
hold on
used to tell sb to wait or stop
Hold on a minute while I get my breath back.
Hold on! This isn't the right road.

data.chText: （在困境或危险中）坚持住，挺住
data.enText: to survive in a difficult or dangerous situation

data.chText: 他们勉强坚持到救援到来。
data.enText: They managed to hold on until help arrived.
used on the telephone to ask sb to wait until they can talk to the person they want

data.chText: 等一下行吗？我去看看他在不在。
data.enText: Can you hold on? I'll see if he's here.
hold sth↔on
to keep sth in position

data.chText: 这些螺母和螺栓把轮子固定住了。
data.enText: These nuts and bolts hold the wheels on.

data.chText: 这个旋钮只是用胶带粘住的。
data.enText: The knob is only held on by sticky tape.
hold on (to sth/sb)
hold onto sth/sb
to keep holding sth/sb

data.chText: 握紧，等我让你松手时再松开。
data.enText: Hold on and don't let go until I say so.

data.chText: 他扶住椅子后背，以免摔倒。
data.enText: He held onto the back of the chair to stop himself from falling.
hold on to sth
hold onto sth

data.chText: 保住（优势）；不送（或不卖）某物
data.enText: to keep sth that is an advantage for you; to not give or sell sth to sb else

data.chText: 你应该继续保留住你的石油股份。
data.enText: You should hold on to your oil shares.

data.chText: 赛跑一开始她便冲到了前面，并九圈一直保持领先。
data.enText: She took an early lead in the race and held onto it for nine laps.

data.chText: （替别人或更长时间地）保存某物
data.enText: to keep sth for sb else or for longer than usual

data.chText: 你回来之前我将一直替你保管邮件。
data.enText: I'll hold onto your mail for you until you get back.
hold out
to last, especially in a difficult situation

data.chText: 我们可以在这里一直待到我们的储备品用完。
data.enText: We can stay here for as long as our supplies hold out.
to resist or survive in a dangerous or difficult situation

data.chText: 反叛分子在山区顽抗了几年。
data.enText: The rebels held out in the mountains for several years.
hold out sth

data.chText: 提供机会；给予希望；使有可能
data.enText: to offer a chance, hope or possibility of sth

data.chText: 医生对她的痊愈不抱很大的希望。
data.enText: Doctors hold out little hope of her recovering.
hold sth↔out

data.chText: 伸出手（或胳膊）；递出东西
data.enText: to put your hand or arms, or sth in your hand, towards sb, especially to give or offer sth
I held out my hand to steady her.

data.chText: 他伸手把钥匙递过来，我接了。
data.enText: He held out the keys and I took them.
hold out for sth
to cause a delay in reaching an agreement because you hope you will gain sth

data.chText: 工会谈判代表拖延着，以期达成较优厚的薪酬协议。
data.enText: The union negotiators are holding out for a more generous pay settlement.
hold out on sb
to refuse to tell or give sb sth
hold sth↔over
to not deal with sth immediately; to leave sth to be dealt with later

data.chText: 这件事被推迟到下次会议。
data.enText: The matter was held over until the next meeting.

data.chText: 延长（电影、戏剧等）的上演期
data.enText: to show a film/movie, play, etc. for longer than planned

data.chText: 这部电影十分受欢迎，因此又继续上演了一周。
data.enText: The movie proved so popular it was held over for another week.
hold sth over sb

data.chText: 以某事要挟（或威逼）某人
data.enText: to use knowledge that you have about sb to threaten them or make them do what you want
hold sb to sth
to make sb keep a promise

data.chText: 压住对方；不让对方的（得分等）超过己方
data.enText: to stop an opposing team scoring more points, etc. than you

data.chText: 联赛积分领先的队被逼成了0:0的平局。
data.enText: The league leaders were held to a 0–0 draw.
hold together
hold sth ↔ together
to remain, or to keep sth, united

data.chText: 一个政党应当团结一致。
data.enText: A political party should hold together.

data.chText: 使全家人凝聚在一起的通常是母亲。
data.enText: It's the mother who usually holds the family together.

before.enText: of an argument, a theory or a story

data.enText: to be logical or consistent

data.chText: 你看一下证据就知道他们的论点前后不一致。
data.enText: Their case doesn't hold together when you look at the evidence.
if a machine or an object holds together or sth holds it together , the different parts stay together so that it does not break
hold up

data.chText: 支持住；承受住；支撑得住
data.enText: to remain strong and working effectively
She's holding up well under the pressure.
hold sb/sth↔up
to support sb/sth and stop them from falling
to delay or block the movement or progress of sb/sth

data.chText: 一场事故造成了交通阻塞。
data.enText: An accident is holding up traffic.

data.chText: 我的申请因邮政部门罢工而耽搁了。
data.enText: My application was held up by the postal strike.

data.chText: 举出（例子）；提出（作为榜样）
data.enText: to use or present sb/sth as an example

data.chText: 她总是举例说自己的孩子表现如何好。
data.enText: She's always holding up her children as models of good behaviour.

data.chText: 他的想法被当成了笑料。
data.enText: His ideas were held up to ridicule.
hold up sth
to steal from a bank, shop/store, etc. using a gun
hold with sth

before.enText: used in negative sentences or in questions

data.enText: to agree with sth
I don't hold with the use of force.

data.chText: 他们不赞成让孩子随心所欲地看太多电视。
data.enText: They don't hold with letting children watch as much TV as they want.
with hand
the action of holding sb/sth; the way you are holding sb/sth

data.chText: 他把她的胳膊抓得更紧了。
data.enText: His hold on her arm tightened.

data.chText: 她尽力拉住那孩子的手不放。
data.enText: She tried to keep hold of the child's hand.
Make sure you've got a steady hold on the camera.
in sport

data.chText: 持；握；抓；抱；（尤指摔跤、拳击中的）擒拿法
data.enText: a particular way of holding sb, especially in a sport such as wrestling or in a fight

data.chText: 那位摔跤手给对手来了个头部擒拿。
data.enText: The wrestler put his opponent into a head hold.
power/control
influence, power or control over sb/sth

data.chText: 她知道他的过去，所以能够控制他。
data.enText: What she knew about his past gave her a hold over him.

data.chText: 他竭力压制自己的怒火。
data.enText: He struggled to get a hold of his anger.
in climbing

data.chText: 支撑点（可手攀或脚踏的地方）
data.enText: a place where you can put your hands or feet when climbing
on ship/plane
the part of a ship or plane where the goods being carried are stored
catch, get, grab, take, etc. (a) hold of sb/sth
to have or take sb/sth in your hands

data.chText: 他抓住她的手腕，使她无法挣脱。
data.enText: He caught hold of her wrists so she couldn't get away.
Lee got hold of the dog by its collar.
Quick, grab a hold of that rope.

data.chText: 她轻轻地握住门把手扭动了它。
data.enText: Gently, she took hold of the door handle and turned it.
get hold of sb
to contact or find sb

data.chText: 你去哪了？我一整天都在找你。
data.enText: Where have you been? I've been trying to get hold of you all day.
get hold of sth
to find sth that you want or need

data.chText: 我需要找到汤姆的地址。
data.enText: I need to get hold of Tom's address.

data.chText: 几乎不可能搞到决赛的门票。
data.enText: It's almost impossible to get hold of tickets for the final.
to learn or understand sth
no holds barred
with no rules or limits on what sb is allowed to do
on hold
delayed until a later time or date

data.chText: 她中断了事业以便生孩子。
data.enText: She put her career on hold to have a baby.

data.chText: 这项工程暂停，等到有更多的钱时再进行。
data.enText: The project is on hold until more money is available.
if a person on the telephone is put on hold , they have to wait until the person that they want to talk to is free
take (a) hold

data.chText: 开始完全控制；变得十分强大
data.enText: to begin to have complete control over sb/sth; to become very strong

data.chText: 他突然惊慌得动弹不得。
data.enText: Panic took hold of him and he couldn't move.

data.chText: 他们就在大火吞噬房子之前逃了出来。
data.enText: They got out of the house just before the flames took hold.
It is best to treat the disease early before it takes a hold.
get (hold of) the wrong end of the stick
to understand sth in the wrong way

data.text: hold ♦ hold on ♦ cling ♦ clutch ♦ grip ♦ grasp ♦ clasp ♦ hang on

data.chText: 以上各词均含抓住、抱住、托住、握住之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to have sb/sth in your hands, arms, etc.
hold
to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.
She was holding a large box.

data.chText: 我把婴儿轻轻地抱在怀里。
data.enText: I held the baby gently in my arms.
hold on (to sb/sth)
to continue to hold sb/sth; to put your hand on sb/sth and not take your hand away

data.chText: 握紧，我让你松手时再松开。
data.enText: Hold on and don't let go until I say so.
cling

data.chText: 尤指用身体紧抱、紧握、抓紧：
data.enText: to hold on to sb/sth tightly, especially with your whole body

data.chText: 生还者紧紧抱住一块块漂浮在水面上的残骸。
data.enText: Survivors clung to pieces of floating debris.
clutch

data.chText: 尤指用手抓紧、紧握、抱紧、突然抓住：
data.enText: to hold sb/sth tightly, especially in your hand; to take hold of sth suddenly

data.chText: 她站在那里，手里仍然紧握着花束。
data.enText: She stood there, the flowers still clutched in her hand.

data.chText: 他感到自己滑了一下，便一把抓住一根树枝。
data.enText: He felt himself slipping and clutched at a branch.
grip
to hold on to sth very tightly with your hand
Grip the rope as tightly as you can.
grasp
to take hold of sth firmly

data.chText: 他热情地抓着我的手握了起来。
data.enText: He grasped my hand and shook it warmly.
The object of grasp is often sb's hand or wrist .
clasp
( formal ) to hold sb/sth tightly in your hand or in your arms

data.chText: 他们相互紧握着对方的手。
data.enText: They clasped hands (= held each other's hands) .

data.chText: 她把孩子紧紧地搂在怀里。
data.enText: She clasped the children in her arms.

data.chText: clasp的宾语通常为hand或另一个人。
data.enText: The object of clasp is often your hands , sb else's hand or another person.
hang on (to sth)

data.chText: 尤指为支撑自己或防止跌倒紧紧抓住某物：
data.enText: to hold on to sth very tightly, especially in order to support yourself or stop yourself from falling
Hang on tight. We're off!
to hold/clutch/grip/clasp sth in your hand/hands
to hold/catch/clasp sb/sth in your arms
to grip/grasp sth with your hand/hands
to hold/clutch/grip/grasp/clasp/hang on to sth
to hold/cling/hang on
to hold/clutch/clasp sb/sth to you
to hold/hold on to/cling to/clutch/grip/grasp/clasp/hang on to sb/sth tight/tightly/firmly

means: 捂住，按住(受伤的身体部位等)
使（注意力或兴趣）持续不减

ex.chText: 这辆车可以坐4个人。
ex.enText: This car can hold four people.

ex.chText: 这个瓶子能装多少水？
ex.enText: How much water does this bottle hold?

synonyms.bx: 指容纳某一数量的人或事物，强调包容的能力。

ex.chText: 瓶子里装着什么？
ex.enText: What is contained in the bottle?

ex.chText: 这个书架上现在有60本书，但它能装下150本。
ex.enText: This bookshelf currently contains 60 books but can hold 150 ones.

ex.chText: 水中含有矿物质。
ex.enText: Water contains minerals.

ex.chText: 这份报告包含你所需的一切数据。
ex.enText: This report contains all the data you need.

synonyms.bx: 指容器装有具体东西，含仍有剩余空间之意；也指包含具体之物或数据、信息等。

ex.chText: 这辆新车包含了许多改进。
ex.enText: The new car embodies many improvements.

ex.chText: 那项提案包含在决议草案中吗？
ex.enText: Has the proposal been embodied in that draft resolution?

synonyms.bx: 指包含某些内容，而这些内容是某事物的组成部分。

ex.chText: 自然科学包括许多学科。
ex.enText: Natural science embraces many subjects.

ex.chText: 该理论涉及心理学的不同方面。
ex.enText: This theory embraces different aspects of psychology.

synonyms.bx: 指包含和整体有关的细节。

ex.chText: 这个价格包括早饭吗？
ex.enText: Does the price include breakfast?

ex.chText: 她的作品包括小说和散文。
ex.enText: Her writings include novels and prose.

synonyms.bx: 指包括属于整体的部分，可以是具体的或抽象的。

ex.chText: 新员工们需要知道这份工作包括什么。
ex.enText: New employees need to know what the job will involve.

ex.chText: 考试将包括朗读一则新闻。
ex.enText: The test will involve reading a piece of news.

ex.chText: 她没想到写一部小说需要做这么多的工作。
ex.enText: She didn't realize writing a novel involved so much work.

synonyms.bx: 指必然包括某种结果，所接的事物通常是抽象的。

ex.chText: 她热情地拥抱女儿。
ex.enText: She embraced her daughter warmly.

ex.chText: 这两个人见面后拥抱在一起。
ex.enText: The two men met and embraced.

ex.chText: 那个女人把孩子紧紧搂在怀里。
ex.enText: The woman clasped the baby to her bosom.

ex.chText: 他把金子紧紧地攥在手里。
ex.enText: He clasped the gold in his hand.

ex.chText: 他把女友紧紧搂入怀中。
ex.enText: He clasped his girlfriend to him.

ex.chText: 她怀里抱着一个婴儿。
ex.enText: She held a baby in her arms.

ex.chText: 这对年轻恋人紧紧相拥。
ex.enText: The young lovers held each other close.

ex.chText: 他们见面后抱在一起。
ex.enText: They met and hugged.

ex.chText: 他们见面后，她抱住了他。
ex.enText: She hugged him when they met.

ex.chText: 她抱着胳膊坐在角落里。
ex.enText: She was sitting in a corner hugging herself.

synonyms.bx: 既可表示拥抱他人，也可表示抱住自己的身体。

ex.chText: 他眼睛是棕色的。
ex.enText: He has brown eyes.

ex.chText: 他在乡下有一所房子。
ex.enText: He has a house in the country.

ex.chText: 瓶子里还有啤酒。
ex.enText: The bottle still has beer in it.

ex.chText: 群众有无限的创造力。
ex.enText: The masses have boundless creative power.

synonyms.bx: 又作 have got, 指拥有某物并可随时使用，作此义解时，通常用于口语；也指具有某种外表、特性、特征等或包括某物在内。

ex.chText: 我们都享有公费医疗。
ex.enText: We all enjoy free medical care.

ex.chText: 那里的人们享有广泛的民主和自由。
ex.enText: The people there enjoy extensive democracy and freedom.

synonyms.bx: 通常指享有声誉、权利、利益等好的东西。

ex.chText: 他持有这家企业的大部分股份。
ex.enText: He held most of the shares in the business.

ex.chText: 最后一名拥有该称号的英国人是谁？
ex.enText: Who was the last Briton to hold the title?

ex.chText: 关于此事，他们依然持那种看法。
ex.enText: They still hold that view on the matter.

synonyms.bx: 指拥有某些财产或头衔，也可表示心中怀有某种看法。

ex.chText: 他拥有这所房子。
ex.enText: He owns this house.

ex.chText: 这棵树归谁所有？
ex.enText: Who owns this tree?

synonyms.bx: 指具有所有权，尤指因购买、接受赠予等而合法地拥有。

ex.chText: 罗丝是一个拥有非凡智慧的女人。
ex.enText: Rose is a woman who possesses rare intelligence.

ex.chText: 我们需要品质优秀的年轻人。
ex.enText: We need young people who possess good qualities.

ex.chText: 他私藏海洛因的罪名成立。
ex.enText: He was found guilty of possessing heroin.

synonyms.bx: 通常指拥有某种好的品质、能力等，也指持有某物。

data.chText: 大多数含hold的习语，都可在该等习语中的名词及形容词相关词条找到，如hold the fort在词条fort下。
data.enText: Most idioms containing hold are at the entries for the nouns and adjectives in the idioms, for example hold the fort is at fort .
hold good
to be true

data.chText: 同样的论点并非在所有的情况下都正确。
data.enText: The same argument does not hold good in every case.
hold it
used to ask sb to wait, or not to move

data.chText: 请稍候——我想人还没有到齐。
data.enText: Hold it a second─I don't think everyone's arrived yet.
there is no holding sb
a person cannot be prevented from doing sth

data.chText: 她一谈起政治就滔滔不绝。
data.enText: Once she gets onto the subject of politics there's no holding her.
catch, get, grab, take, etc. (a) hold of sb/sth
to have or take sb/sth in your hands

data.chText: 他抓住她的手腕，使她无法挣脱。
data.enText: He caught hold of her wrists so she couldn't get away.
Lee got hold of the dog by its collar.
Quick, grab a hold of that rope.

data.chText: 她轻轻地握住门把手扭动了它。
data.enText: Gently, she took hold of the door handle and turned it.
get hold of sb
to contact or find sb

data.chText: 你去哪了？我一整天都在找你。
data.enText: Where have you been? I've been trying to get hold of you all day.
get hold of sth
to find sth that you want or need

data.chText: 我需要找到汤姆的地址。
data.enText: I need to get hold of Tom's address.

data.chText: 几乎不可能搞到决赛的门票。
data.enText: It's almost impossible to get hold of tickets for the final.
to learn or understand sth
no holds barred
with no rules or limits on what sb is allowed to do
on hold
delayed until a later time or date

data.chText: 她中断了事业以便生孩子。
data.enText: She put her career on hold to have a baby.

data.chText: 这项工程暂停，等到有更多的钱时再进行。
data.enText: The project is on hold until more money is available.
if a person on the telephone is put on hold , they have to wait until the person that they want to talk to is free
take (a) hold

data.chText: 开始完全控制；变得十分强大
data.enText: to begin to have complete control over sb/sth; to become very strong

data.chText: 他突然惊慌得动弹不得。
data.enText: Panic took hold of him and he couldn't move.

data.chText: 他们就在大火吞噬房子之前逃了出来。
data.enText: They got out of the house just before the flames took hold.
It is best to treat the disease early before it takes a hold.
get (hold of) the wrong end of the stick
to understand sth in the wrong way
hold sth against sb

data.chText: 因某人的所为而对其评价低
data.enText: to allow sth that sb has done to make you have a lower opinion of them

data.chText: 我承认我做错了——但别因此而看不起我。
data.enText: I admit I made a mistake─but don't hold it against me.
hold sb/sth↔back
to prevent sb/sth from moving forward or crossing sth
The police were unable to hold back the crowd.
to prevent the progress or development of sb/sth

data.chText: 你认为把不同能力的学生混合在一起的班级会妨碍较高水平学生的进步吗？
data.enText: Do you think that mixed-ability classes hold back the better students?
hold sth↔back

data.chText: 不向（某人）透露情况；隐瞒
data.enText: to not tell sb sth they want or need to know
to hold back information

data.chText: 抑制，控制（感情等）；不露声色
data.enText: to stop yourself from expressing how you really feel

data.chText: 她勉强压住了自己的怒火。
data.enText: She just managed to hold back her anger.

data.chText: 他勇敢地没让眼泪流出来。
data.enText: He bravely held back his tears.
hold back (from doing sth)
hold sb back (from doing sth)
to hesitate or to make sb hesitate to act or speak

data.chText: 她踌躇着，不知如何说出这一可怕的消息。
data.enText: She held back, not knowing how to break the terrible news.

data.chText: 我本想告诉他真实情况，但又开不了口。
data.enText: I wanted to tell him the truth, but something held me back.
hold sb↔down
to prevent sb from moving, using force
It took three men to hold him down.

data.chText: 剥夺某人的自由（或权利）
data.enText: to prevent sb from having their freedom or rights

data.chText: 人民受到了专制政权的压迫。
data.enText: The people are held down by a repressive regime.
hold sth↔down
to keep sth at a low level

data.chText: 通货膨胀率必须控制在低水平上。
data.enText: The rate of inflation must be held down.
to keep a job for some time

data.chText: 他精神崩溃以后就没能保住工作。
data.enText: He was unable to hold down a job after his breakdown.
to limit sth, especially a noise
Hold it down, will you? I'm trying to sleep!
hold forth
to speak for a long time about sth in a way that other people might find boring
hold sth↔in
to not express how you really feel
to hold in your feelings/anger
hold off
to not start

data.chText: 雨还好，等到我们用完野餐才下起来。
data.enText: The rain held off just long enough for us to have our picnic.
to not do sth immediately

data.chText: 我们现在就可以买新计算机，不然就等到降价再说。
data.enText: We could get a new computer now or hold off until prices are lower.

data.chText: 你能推迟几天再作决定吗？
data.enText: Could you hold off making your decision for a few days?
hold sb/sth↔off
to stop sb/sth defeating you

data.chText: 她最后一刻甩掉了所有对手，以新的纪录赢得了赛跑冠军。
data.enText: She held off all the last-minute challengers and won the race in a new record time.
hold on
used to tell sb to wait or stop
Hold on a minute while I get my breath back.
Hold on! This isn't the right road.

data.chText: （在困境或危险中）坚持住，挺住
data.enText: to survive in a difficult or dangerous situation

data.chText: 他们勉强坚持到救援到来。
data.enText: They managed to hold on until help arrived.
used on the telephone to ask sb to wait until they can talk to the person they want

data.chText: 等一下行吗？我去看看他在不在。
data.enText: Can you hold on? I'll see if he's here.
hold sth↔on
to keep sth in position

data.chText: 这些螺母和螺栓把轮子固定住了。
data.enText: These nuts and bolts hold the wheels on.

data.chText: 这个旋钮只是用胶带粘住的。
data.enText: The knob is only held on by sticky tape.
hold on (to sth/sb)
hold onto sth/sb
to keep holding sth/sb

data.chText: 握紧，等我让你松手时再松开。
data.enText: Hold on and don't let go until I say so.

data.chText: 他扶住椅子后背，以免摔倒。
data.enText: He held onto the back of the chair to stop himself from falling.
hold on to sth
hold onto sth

data.chText: 保住（优势）；不送（或不卖）某物
data.enText: to keep sth that is an advantage for you; to not give or sell sth to sb else

data.chText: 你应该继续保留住你的石油股份。
data.enText: You should hold on to your oil shares.

data.chText: 赛跑一开始她便冲到了前面，并九圈一直保持领先。
data.enText: She took an early lead in the race and held onto it for nine laps.

data.chText: （替别人或更长时间地）保存某物
data.enText: to keep sth for sb else or for longer than usual

data.chText: 你回来之前我将一直替你保管邮件。
data.enText: I'll hold onto your mail for you until you get back.
hold out
to last, especially in a difficult situation

data.chText: 我们可以在这里一直待到我们的储备品用完。
data.enText: We can stay here for as long as our supplies hold out.
to resist or survive in a dangerous or difficult situation

data.chText: 反叛分子在山区顽抗了几年。
data.enText: The rebels held out in the mountains for several years.
hold out sth

data.chText: 提供机会；给予希望；使有可能
data.enText: to offer a chance, hope or possibility of sth

data.chText: 医生对她的痊愈不抱很大的希望。
data.enText: Doctors hold out little hope of her recovering.
hold sth↔out

data.chText: 伸出手（或胳膊）；递出东西
data.enText: to put your hand or arms, or sth in your hand, towards sb, especially to give or offer sth
I held out my hand to steady her.

data.chText: 他伸手把钥匙递过来，我接了。
data.enText: He held out the keys and I took them.
hold out for sth
to cause a delay in reaching an agreement because you hope you will gain sth

data.chText: 工会谈判代表拖延着，以期达成较优厚的薪酬协议。
data.enText: The union negotiators are holding out for a more generous pay settlement.
hold out on sb
to refuse to tell or give sb sth
hold sth↔over
to not deal with sth immediately; to leave sth to be dealt with later

data.chText: 这件事被推迟到下次会议。
data.enText: The matter was held over until the next meeting.

data.chText: 延长（电影、戏剧等）的上演期
data.enText: to show a film/movie, play, etc. for longer than planned

data.chText: 这部电影十分受欢迎，因此又继续上演了一周。
data.enText: The movie proved so popular it was held over for another week.
hold sth over sb

data.chText: 以某事要挟（或威逼）某人
data.enText: to use knowledge that you have about sb to threaten them or make them do what you want
hold sb to sth
to make sb keep a promise

data.chText: 压住对方；不让对方的（得分等）超过己方
data.enText: to stop an opposing team scoring more points, etc. than you

data.chText: 联赛积分领先的队被逼成了0:0的平局。
data.enText: The league leaders were held to a 0–0 draw.
hold together
hold sth ↔ together
to remain, or to keep sth, united

data.chText: 一个政党应当团结一致。
data.enText: A political party should hold together.

data.chText: 使全家人凝聚在一起的通常是母亲。
data.enText: It's the mother who usually holds the family together.

before.enText: of an argument, a theory or a story

data.enText: to be logical or consistent

data.chText: 你看一下证据就知道他们的论点前后不一致。
data.enText: Their case doesn't hold together when you look at the evidence.
if a machine or an object holds together or sth holds it together , the different parts stay together so that it does not break
hold up

data.chText: 支持住；承受住；支撑得住
data.enText: to remain strong and working effectively
She's holding up well under the pressure.
hold sb/sth↔up
to support sb/sth and stop them from falling
to delay or block the movement or progress of sb/sth

data.chText: 一场事故造成了交通阻塞。
data.enText: An accident is holding up traffic.

data.chText: 我的申请因邮政部门罢工而耽搁了。
data.enText: My application was held up by the postal strike.

data.chText: 举出（例子）；提出（作为榜样）
data.enText: to use or present sb/sth as an example

data.chText: 她总是举例说自己的孩子表现如何好。
data.enText: She's always holding up her children as models of good behaviour.

data.chText: 他的想法被当成了笑料。
data.enText: His ideas were held up to ridicule.
hold up sth
to steal from a bank, shop/store, etc. using a gun
hold with sth

before.enText: used in negative sentences or in questions

data.enText: to agree with sth
I don't hold with the use of force.

data.chText: 他们不赞成让孩子随心所欲地看太多电视。
data.enText: They don't hold with letting children watch as much TV as they want.

trans: 抑制住，忍住（眼泪、笑声等）
（在比赛或竞赛中）抵挡住（对手的挑战）
举出…（作为批评或赞扬的对象）

example: he released his clasp on my arm
he has a strong grip for an old man
she kept a firm hold on the railing

tr: the space in a ship or aircraft for storing cargo
the appendage to an object that is designed to be held in order to use or move it
example: he grabbed the hammer by the handle
it was an old briefcase but it still had a good grip

tr: a cell in a jail or prison
power by which something or someone is affected or dominated
example: he has a hold over them

tr: understanding of the nature or meaning or quality or magnitude of something
example: he has a good grasp of accounting practices

tr: a state of being confined (usually for a short time)
example: his detention was politically motivated
the prisoner is on hold
he is in the custody of police

tr: time during which some action is awaited
example: instant replay caused too long a delay
he ordered a hold in the action
hold your breath
I hold to these ideas
Rousseau's philosophy holds that people are inherently good

tr: keep in mind or convey as a conviction or view
example: take for granted
view as important
hold these truths to be self-evident
I hold him personally responsible
The soprano held the audience
This story held our interest
She can hold an audience spellbound
We agreed on the terms of the settlement
I can't agree with you!
I hold with those who say life is sacred
Both philosophers concord on this point
She was declared incompetent
judge held that the defendant was innocent
He's held by a contract
I'll hold you by your promise

tr: protect against a challenge or attack
example: Hold that position behind the trees!
Hold the bridge against the enemy's attacks
Hold the fire extinguisher directly on the flames

tr: drink alcohol without showing ill effects
example: He can hold his liquor
he had drunk more than he could carry

tr: have or hold in one's hands or grip
example: Hold this bowl for a moment, please
A crazy idea took hold of him
The beam holds up the roof
He supported me with one hand while I balanced on the beam
What's holding that mirror?

tr: to close within bounds, limit or hold back from movement
example: This holds the local until the express passengers change trains
About a dozen animals were held inside the stockade
The illegal immigrants were held at a detention center
The terrorists held the journalists for ransom

tr: cover as for protection against noise or smell
example: She held her ears when the jackhammer started to operate
hold one's nose

tr: support or hold in a certain manner
example: She holds her head high
He carried himself upright
hold a reception
have, throw, or make a party
give a course
bear a grudge
entertain interesting notions
harbor a resentment
Halt the engines
Arrest the progress
halt the presses

tr: have or possess, either in a concrete or an abstract sense
example: She has $1,000 in the bank
He has got two beautiful daughters
She holds a Master's degree from Harvard

tr: secure and keep for possible future use or application
example: The landlord retained the security deposit
I reserve the right to disagree
She bears the title of Duchess
He held the governorship for almost a decade

tr: take and maintain control over, often by violent means
example: The dissatisfied students held the President's office for almost a week
Hold the taxi
Hold the horse

tr: arrange for and reserve (something for someone else) in advance
example: reserve me a seat on a flight
The agent booked tickets to the show for the whole family
please hold a table at Maxim's
moderate your alcohol intake
hold your tongue
hold your temper
control your anger
hold all calls to the President's office while he is in a meeting
This theory still holds

tr: be pertinent or relevant or applicable
example: The same laws apply to you!
This theory holds for all irrational numbers
The same rules go for everyone

tr: keep in a certain state, position, or activity
example: hold in place
She always held herself as a lady
The students keep me on my toes

tr: remain in a certain state, position, or condition
example: The weather held
They held on the road and kept marching
The jar carries wine
The canteen holds fresh water
This can contains water

tr: be capable of holding or containing
example: This box won't take all the items
The flask holds one gallon
The politician defied public opinion
The new material withstands even the greatest wear and tear
The bridge held
This hotel can accommodate 250 guests
The theater admits 300 people
The auditorium can't hold more than 500 people
The novel holds many surprises
The book holds in store much valuable advise

value.def: When you hold something, you carry or support it, using your hands or your arms.

example.ex: Hold the knife at an angle...
example.tran: 斜握住刀。

example.ex: She is holding her journal and a pen...
example.tran: 她手里拿着日记和一支笔。

example.ex: He held the pistol in his right hand...
example.tran: 他右手握着手枪。

example.ex: Hold the baby while I load the car.
example.tran: 你先抱着孩子，让我把东西装上车。

example.ex: He released his hold on the camera.
example.tran: 他松手放开了照相机。

value.def: Hold is used in expressions such as grab hold of ,catch hold of, and get hold of, to indicate that you close your hand tightly around something, for example to stop something moving or falling.

example.ex: I was woken up by someone grabbing hold of my sleeping bag...
example.tran: 有人猛地抓住了我的睡袋，把我惊醒了。

example.ex: A doctor and a nurse caught hold of his arms...
example.tran: 一名医生和一名护士抓住了他的双臂。

example.ex: Mother took hold of the barking dogs by their collars.
example.tran: 母亲拉住了那几只吠叫的狗的项圈。

value.def: When you hold someone, you put your arms round them, usually because you want to show them how much you like them or because you want to comfort them.

example.ex: If only he would hold her close to him.
example.tran: 要是他能将她拥入怀中就好了。

value.tran: （通常为表示喜爱或安慰而）拥抱，抱住

value.def: If you hold someone in a particular position, you use force to keep them in that position and stop them from moving.

example.ex: He then held the man in an armlock until police arrived...
example.tran: 然后他反扭住那名男子的手臂让他动弹不得，直到警察赶到。

example.ex: I'd got two nurses holding me down.
example.tran: 两名护士按着我不让我乱动。

value.def: A hold is a particular way of keeping someone in a position using your own hands, arms, or legs.

example.ex: ...use of an unauthorized hold on a handcuffed suspect.
example.tran: 对戴手铐的嫌疑犯使用非法的擒拿方式

value.tran: （使某人不得动弹的）抓住，夹住

value.def: When you hold a part of your body, you put your hand on or against it, often because it hurts.

example.ex: Soon she was crying bitterly about the pain and was holding her throat.
example.tran: 很快她痛得大哭起来，同时用手捂着自己的喉咙。

value.def: When you hold a part of your body in a particular position, you put it into that position and keep it there.

example.ex: Hold your hands in front of your face...
example.tran: 把双手举在面前。

example.ex: He walked at a rapid pace with his back straight and his head held erect.
example.tran: 他昂首挺胸地快步而行。

value.tran: 使（身体部位）保持（某种姿势）

value.def: If one thing holds another in a particular position, it keeps it in that position.

example.ex: ...the wooden wedge which held the heavy door open...
example.tran: 卡住沉重的门不让它关上的木楔

example.ex: They used steel pins to hold everything in place.
example.tran: 他们用钢钉将所有东西都固定住。

value.def: If one thing is used to hold another, it is used to store it.

example.ex: Two knife racks hold her favourite knives.
example.tran: 两个刀架上存放着她最心爱的刀具。

example.ex: ...the large cardboard and wooden cases used to hold my new appliances.
example.tran: 用来装我新买的家用电器的几个大的纸箱和木箱

value.def: In a ship or aeroplane, a hold is a place where cargo or luggage is stored.

example.ex: A fire had been reported in the cargo hold.
example.tran: 行李舱内报称起火了。

value.def: If a place holds something, it keeps it available for reference or for future use.

example.ex: The Small Firms Service holds an enormous amount of information on any business problem...
example.tran: 小型企业服务处备有关于各种商务问题的海量信息。

example.ex: We have reviewed the data that we hold for the area.
example.tran: 我们已经审核过为该地区保存的数据了。

value.def: If something holds a particular amount of something, it can contain that amount.

example.ex: The small bottles don't seem to hold much...
example.tran: 这些小瓶子好像装不下多少。

example.ex: One CD-ROM disk can hold over 100,000 pages of text.
example.tran: 一张光盘可以存储十多万多页的文字资料。

value.def: If you can hold your drink, you are able to drink large quantities of alcohol without becoming ill or getting drunk.

example.ex: ...but you had to be able to hold your liquor.
example.tran: 但你得能喝酒才行。

value.def: If a vehicle holds the road well, it remains in close contact with the road and can be controlled safely and easily.

example.ex: I thought the car held the road really well.
example.tran: 我认为这辆车抓地性能真的非常好。

value.def: Hold is used with words and expressions indicating an opinion or belief, to show that someone has a particular opinion or believes that something is true.

example.ex: He held firm opinions which usually conflicted with my own...
example.tran: 他对自己的观点坚定不移，而这些观点通常和我的相左。

example.ex: He holds certain expectations about the teacher's role...
example.tran: 他对教师的角色抱有某些期待。

example.ex: Current thinking holds that obesity is more a medical than a psychological problem...
example.tran: 现在的观点认为，肥胖更多的是医学问题而非心理问题。

example.ex: The public, meanwhile, hold architects in low esteem.
example.tran: 与此同时，公众对建筑师并不看重。

example.ex: ...a widely held opinion.
example.tran: 普遍的看法

value.def: Hold is used with words such as 'fear' or 'mystery' to indicate someone's feelings towards something, as if those feelings were a characteristic of the thing itself.

example.ex: Death doesn't hold any fear for me...
example.tran: 死亡对我来说并不可怕。

example.ex: It held more mystery than even the darkest jungle...
example.tran: 它甚至比最黑暗的丛林还更令人感到神秘。

example.ex: This approach, more than any other, holds promise for true reform.
example.tran: 这一方法比其他任何方法都更让人看到真正改革的希望。

value.tran: 带给人，使人感到（害怕、神秘等）

value.def: Hold is used with nouns such as 'office', 'power', and 'responsibility' to indicate that someone has a particular position of power or authority.

example.ex: She has never held ministerial office...
example.tran: 她从未担任过部长级职务。

example.ex: I'd seen it before in people who held immense power.
example.tran: 我以前曾在掌握大权的人身上看到过这种情况。

value.tran: 担任（职务）;掌握（权力）;负有（责任）

value.def: Hold is used with nouns such as 'permit', 'degree', or 'ticket' to indicate that someone has a particular document that allows them to do something.

example.ex: Applicants should normally hold a good Honours degree...
example.tran: 申请人通常应该拥有优秀荣誉学位。

example.ex: He did not hold a firearm certificate...
example.tran: 他没有持枪许可。

example.ex: Passengers holding tickets will receive refunds.
example.tran: 持票旅客将会得到退款。

value.tran: 持有（许可、票证等）;拥有（学位等）

value.def: Hold is used with nouns such as 'party', 'meeting', 'talks', 'election', and 'trial' to indicate that people are organizing a particular activity.

example.ex: The country will hold democratic elections within a year...
example.tran: 该国将在一年之内举行民主选举。

example.ex: The German sports federation said it would hold an investigation.
example.tran: 德国体育联合会称它将进行调查。

example.ex: ...the club, which was licensed to hold parties.
example.tran: 获准举办各种聚会的俱乐部

value.tran: 举行（聚会、会议、会谈、选举、审判等）

example.ex: They also called for the holding of multi-party general elections.
example.tran: 他们还呼吁举行多党大选。

value.def: Hold is used with nouns such as 'conversation', 'interview', and 'talks' to indicate that two or more people meet and discuss something.

example.ex: The Prime Minister, is holding consultations with his colleagues to finalise the deal...
example.tran: 首相正在和同僚进行磋商，以敲定该协议。

example.ex: The engineer and his son held frequent consultations concerning technical problems...
example.tran: 工程师和他的儿子经常就技术问题互相征求意见。

example.ex: They can't believe you can even hold a conversation.
example.tran: 他们不敢相信你竟然能够把一场对话进行下去。

value.def: Hold is used with nouns such as 'shares' and 'stock' to indicate that someone owns a particular proportion of a business.

example.ex: The group said it continues to hold 1,774,687 Vons shares...
example.tran: 该集团称其继续持有1,774,687股冯氏公司的股份。

example.ex: The Fisher family holds 40% of the stock.
example.tran: 费希尔家族持有40%的股份。

value.def: Hold is used with words such as 'lead' or 'advantage' to indicate that someone is winning or doing well in a contest.

example.ex: He continued to hold a lead in Angola's presidential race...
example.tran: 他继续在安哥拉总统大选中占据领先地位。

example.ex: Mestel holds a slight advantage.
example.tran: 梅斯特尔占有微弱优势。

value.def: Hold is used with nouns such as 'attention' or 'interest' to indicate that what you do or say keeps someone interested or listening to you.

example.ex: If you want to hold someone's attention, look them directly in the eye but don't stare...
example.tran: 如果想吸引住某人的注意力，就要直视他们的眼睛，但别死盯着。

example.ex: Couldn't I hold Philippe's interest?
example.tran: 我难道就不能让菲利普一直感兴趣吗？

value.tran: 吸引住（注意力）;保持（兴趣）

value.def: If you hold someone responsible, liable, or accountable for something, you will blame them if anything goes wrong.

example.ex: It's impossible to hold any individual responsible.
example.tran: 不可能归咎于任何个人。

example.ex: ...shareholders who want to hold corporate directors more accountable for their actions.
example.tran: 想让公司董事为自己的行为负更大责任的股东们

usage_note.note: Hold is often used to indicate that someone or something has the particular thing, characteristic, or attitude that is mentioned. Therefore it takes most of its meaning from the word that follows it.
usage_note.translation: hold 常用来表示某人或某物具备所提到的某种东西、特征或态度，因此其意义主要视后接之词而定。

value.def: If someone holds you in a place, they keep you there as a prisoner and do not allow you to leave.

example.ex: The inside of a van was as good a place as any to hold a kidnap victim...
example.tran: 小货车内是关押被绑架人的好地方。

example.ex: Somebody is holding your wife hostage...
example.tran: 有人挟持了你妻子作为人质。

example.ex: Japan had originally demanded the return of two seamen held on spying charges.
example.tran: 日本起初要求放回两名以间谍罪名遭拘留的海员。

value.def: If people such as an army or a violent crowd hold a place, they control it by using force.

example.ex: Demonstrators have been holding the square since Sunday.
example.tran: 示威者从周日起就占领了广场。

value.def: If you have a hold over someone, you have power or control over them, for example because you know something about them you can use to threaten them or because you are in a position of authority.

example.ex: It's always useful to have a hold over a fellow like Carl May...
example.tran: 能支配像卡尔·梅这样的人总是很有用的。

example.ex: He had ordered his officers to keep an exceptionally firm hold over their men...
example.tran: 他已经命令军官要倍加严格地管住自己的手下。

example.ex: Because he once loved her, she still has a hold on him.
example.tran: 因为他曾经爱过她，她现在仍能对他产生影响。

value.tran: （因握有某人把柄或掌握权力而形成的）控制力，支配力

value.def: If you ask someone to hold, or to hold the line, when you are answering a telephone call, you are asking them to wait for a short time, for example so that you can find the person they want to speak to.

example.ex: Could you hold the line and I'll just get my pen...
example.tran: 能否请您稍等一会儿，我拿支笔？

example.ex: A telephone operator asked him to hold.
example.tran: 电话接线员让他不要挂断。

value.tran: （接电话时让对方）稍等，不要挂断

value.def: If you hold telephone calls for someone, you do not allow people who phone to speak to that person, but take messages instead.

example.ex: He tells his secretary to hold his calls.
example.tran: 他让秘书代接电话。

value.tran: 代接（电话）并向受话人转告通话内容

value.def: If something holds at a particular value or level, or is held there, it is kept at that value or level.

example.ex: OPEC production is holding at around 21.5 million barrels a day...
example.tran: 石油输出国组织的石油产量保持在每天约2,150万桶。

example.ex: They were expecting the jobless rate to hold steady...
example.tran: 他们预计失业率会保持稳定。

example.ex: The Prime Minister yesterday ruled out Government action to hold down petrol prices...
example.tran: 首相昨天表示政府不会采取行动抑制汽油价格上涨。

example.ex: The final dividend will be held at 20.7p, after an 8 per cent increase.
example.tran: 增长了8%后，最终的红利将会保持在20.7便士的水平。

example.ex: ...provided the pound holds its value against the euro.
example.tran: 只要英镑保持其和欧元之间的比价

value.def: If you hold a sound or musical note, you continue making it.

example.ex: ...a voice which hit and held every note with perfect ease and clarity.
example.tran: 非常自如清晰地唱出并拉长每个音符的歌喉

value.def: If you hold something such as a train, a lift, or an elevator, you delay it.

example.ex: A London Underground spokesman defended the decision to hold the train until police arrived.
example.tran: 伦敦地铁公司的发言人为推迟发车直到警方赶来的决定作了辩解。

value.def: If an offer or invitation still holds, it is still available for you to accept.

example.ex: Does your offer still hold?
example.tran: 你的提议仍然有效吗？

value.def: If a good situation holds, it continues and does not get worse or fail.

example.ex: Our luck couldn't hold for ever...
example.tran: 我们不会永远走运。

example.ex: Would the weather hold?...
example.tran: 天气会保持晴好吗？

example.ex: Will the ceasefire hold?
example.tran: 停火能持续下去吗？

value.def: If an argument or theory holds, it is true or valid, even after close examination.

example.ex: Today, most people think that argument no longer holds...
example.tran: 今天，大多数人认为那个论点已经站不住脚了。

example.ex: The theory could still hold.
example.tran: 该理论有可能仍然成立。

example.ex: Democrats say arguments against the bill won't hold up.
example.tran: 民主党人声称反对该议案的论点站不住脚。

value.def: If part of a structure holds, it does not fall or break although there is a lot of force or pressure on it.

example.ex: How long would the roof hold?
example.tran: 房顶能支撑多久？

value.def: If laws or rules hold, they exist and remain in force.

example.ex: These laws also hold for universities.
example.tran: 这些法律也适用于各大学。

value.def: If you say that you hold to a particular opinion or belief, you are stating firmly that you continue to have that opinion or belief.

example.ex: I hold to my belief that people should be allowed to have private lives...
example.tran: 我坚信应该允许人们拥有自己的私生活。

example.ex: Would you still hold to that view?
example.tran: 你仍会坚持那个看法吗？

value.def: If you hold to a promise or to high standards of behaviour, you keep that promise or continue to behave according to those standards.

example.ex: Will the President be able to hold to this commit-ment?...
example.tran: 总统能恪守此承诺吗？

example.ex: Not all men are as honorable or hold to the same standards as Sam.
example.tran: 不是所有的人都像萨姆那样品德如此高尚，抑或恪守同样的道德准则。

example.ex: ...whether youngsters in a multicultural society can really be expected to hold to uniformity in their speech.
example.tran: 多文化社会中的年轻人是否真的有望坚持言语的统一性

value.tran: 遵守，恪守（承诺或高尚的行为准则）

value.def: If someone or something holds you to a promise or to high standards of behaviour, they make you keep that promise or those standards.

example.ex: I would say it's almost time to hold him to that promise...
example.tran: 我认为已经差不多是时候让他兑现那个承诺了。

example.ex: Don't hold me to that...
example.tran: 我不能百分百保证。

example.ex: It does hold you to certain standards of fairness.
example.tran: 它的确能让你恪守某些公平原则。

value.tran: 使遵守，使恪守（承诺或高尚的行为准则）

value.def: If you hold forth on a subject, you speak confidently and for a long time about it, especially to a group of people.

example.ex: Barry was holding forth on politics.
example.tran: 巴里正在滔滔不绝地谈论政治。

value.def: If you get hold of an object or information, you obtain it, usually after some difficulty.

example.ex: It is hard to get hold of guns in this country.
example.tran: 在这个国家里要搞到枪支是很困难的。

value.def: If you get hold of a fact or a subject, you learn about it and understand it well.

example.ex: He first had to get hold of some basic facts.
example.tran: 他首先得弄清一些基本事实。

value.def: If you get hold of someone, you manage to contact them.

example.ex: The only electrician we could get hold of was miles away.
example.tran: 我们唯一能够联络到的电工离这里有好几英里远。

value.def: If you say 'Hold it', you are telling someone to stop what they are doing and to wait.

example.ex: Hold it! Don't move!
example.tran: 停下！别动！

value.def: If you put something on hold, you decide not to do it, deal with it, or change it now, but to leave it until later.

example.ex: He put his retirement on hold until he had found a solution...
example.tran: 他推迟了退休，直到他找到了解决办法。

example.ex: He described their foreign policy as on hold.
example.tran: 他将他们的外交政策称为缓兵之计。

value.def: If you hold your own, you are able to resist someone who is attacking or opposing you.

example.ex: The Frenchman held his own against the challenger.
example.tran: 这名法国人顶住了挑战者的进攻。

value.tran: （面对攻击、反对等）顶住，坚持住

value.def: If you can do something well enough to hold your own, you do not appear foolish when you are compared with someone who is generally thought to be very good at it.

example.ex: She can hold her own against almost any player.
example.tran: 她几乎能和任何一名选手一较高下。

value.def: If you hold still, you do not move.

example.ex: Can't you hold still for a second?
example.tran: 你一秒钟不动都做不到吗？

value.def: If something takes hold, it gains complete control or influence over a person or thing.

example.ex: She felt a strange excitement taking hold of her...
example.tran: 她浑身感到一股莫名的兴奋。

example.ex: She was determined not to let the illness take hold again.
example.tran: 她决心不让疾病再次击垮自己。

value.def: If you hold tight, you put your hand round or against something in order to prevent yourself from falling over. A bus driver might say 'Hold tight!' to you if you are standing on a bus when it is about to move.

example.ex: He held tight to the rope...
example.tran: 他牢牢抓住绳子。

example.ex: Climb on to my back and hold tight.
example.tran: 爬到我背上抓紧了。

value.def: If you hold tight, you do not immediately start a course of action that you have been planning or thinking about.

example.ex: The unions have circulated their branches, urging members to hold tight until a national deal is struck.
example.tran: 各工会已经在其分支机构中作了宣传工作，敦促会员等到达成全国性协议后再行动。

trans: 同样适用;在…情况下亦然
握住；抓牢；坚持不懈；稍等；等一下；保住，守住（有利因素）；保存；保留；坚持（信仰、信念、原则等）
等等；握住；抓牢；坚持不懈；稍等；等一下
抓紧；坚守；持守；持定；遵守；牢牢抓住
保住（工作或位置）；压制；限制
伸出（手等）；递出；坚持要求；拒绝妥协；（对…）隐瞒信息；坚持抵抗；坚决顶住；寄予（希望）
克制；阻止；阻挡；保留；隐瞒；（使）犹豫；（使）退缩；储备；抑制住，忍住（眼泪、笑声等）
（论点、理论等）站得住脚，成立；举起；抬起；提起；支撑；支承；耽搁；延误；持械抢劫；举出…（作为批评或赞扬的对象）；（在困境中）维持，保持良好；（论点、理论等）经受得住检验
